intro: Gossypium africanum, commonly known as the African cotton plant, is a species native to Africa. It is a herbaceous annual plant that produces fluffy cotton-like fibers in its capsules. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters and has alternate, simple leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white and are pollinated by insects. The botanical significance of Gossypium africanum lies in its role as a wild relative of cultivated cotton species.
